Welcome to packtivity’s documentation!¶

Contents:

packtivity.statecontexts.posixfs_context.contextualize_data(data, context)[source]¶

interpolate data string with context-specific information. here, replace {workdir} with first read-write location

packtivity.statecontexts.posixfs_context.make_new_context(name, oldcontext=None, subdir=True, create=False)[source]¶

creates a new context from an existing context.

if subdir is True it declares a new read-write nested under the old context’s read-write and adds all read-write and read-only locations of the old context as read-only. This is recommended as it makes rolling back changes to the global state made in this context easy.

else the same readwrite/readonly configuration as the parent context is used

packtivity.statecontexts.posixfs_context.reset_state(context)[source]¶

delete readwriteable locations of this context

packtivity.syncbackends.build_job(process, attributes, pack_config)[source]¶

takes a process description and builds a job out of it using a handler.

packtivity.syncbackends.prepublish(spec, attributes, context, pack_config)[source]¶

attempts to prepublish output data, returns None if not possible

packtivity.syncbackends.run_in_env(environment, job, context, pack_config)[source]¶

takes a built job and runs it blockingly in the environment with the state context attached
